outcome_var: Default is coded 1; never having defaulted is coded 0
outcome_description: Used as a measure of cooperation. As defined by Working Capital, default occurs when a member's loan payment is 120 or more days past due. By defaulting on a loan, a group member essen- tially eliminates other group members' access to loans.
predictor_var: Gender - 1 for female and 0 for male

outcome_var: 1 stands for a group paid all installments on time until the survey took place, otherwise 0
outcome_description: defaulters are those group borrowers with minimum default for 91-180 days past due
predictor_var: 1 if the sample group borrower is male and 0 otherwise
covariate_1: 1 if group members knew the other group member/s before the group was formed
covariate_2: 1 if borrowers have other source of credit available and 0 otherwise
covariate_3: 1 if group members know for what purpose the other members have used the loan
covariate_4: 1 if group members know the monthly sales of the other group members
covariate_5: 1 if groups have rules and regulation on how to run the group
covariate_6: 1 if group members regularly visit other group members
covariate_7: 1 if group members help one another in times of need
covariate_8: 1 if group has ever rejected a borrower who would like to join the group
covariate_9: 1 if members are willing to put pressure other members in to repaying
covariate_10: 1 if the member feels anger against defaulting member
covariate_11: 1 if there is a penalty within the group for defaulting members
covariate_12: 1 if group members born in the same area where the survey was held
covariate_13: 1 if group member has ever been a member of another group
covariate_14: number of follow up and supervisory visits made by the DECSI loan officer

outcome_var: 1 if the group succeeds in respecting his contract towards the lender, otherwise 0
outcome_description: External Delinquency replicated the second stage of the repayment decision when the repayment was due
predictor_var: 1 if the group member is female
covariate_1: The average distance (in meter) between the member and the other group members
covariate_2: 1 if the group has regulations and internal laws to reach there
covariate_3: 1 if all group members have the same business
covariate_4: 1 if the member knows the other group members before the formation of the group
covariate_5: The length in number of year spent by the borrower in the same region
covariate_6: Length (in month) during which the borrower was member of his group to the deadline of the loan
covariate_7: 1: will to make pressure to incite repayment
covariate_8: 1 if the group rejects a borrower who wants to join it
covariate_9: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same age (+/-2 years)
covariate_10: 1 if all the group have the same sex
covariate_11: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same level of education
covariate_12: number of members in the group
covariate_14: 1 if the borrower has at least 6 years of education
covariate_15: 1 if the group member is married
covariate_16: 1 if the group member has other sources of money
covariate_17: 1 if the relation with loan officer is very intimate, 0 elsewhere
covariate_18: 1 if the MFI puts at the disposal of borrowers non financial services
covariate_19: 1 if the borrower would have liked to borrow more than the assigned amount
covariate_20: 1 if the monthly visits between members are greater than or equal to 7

outcome_var: 1 denoting loan repayment and 0 for loan default
outcome_description: Whether or not a borrower repaid the loan
covariate_3: 1 if borrower holds a business license
covariate_4: number of years an entrepreneur has been in the business
covariate_5: 1 if the entrepreneur's business was located in the same zip code as the lending agency
covariate_10: Interaction of borrower's income and P2
covariate_11: Interaction of borrower's income and P3
covariate_12: Interaction of borrower license status and P3
covariate_13: Interaction of borrower's business experience and P2
covariate_14: Interaction of business proximity and P3

outcome_var: 1 if the group leader indicates that at least one member has ever misused a loan
outcome_description: By misuse we mean that a member has used the loan for other purposes than he/she initially indicated when obtaining the loan. If misuse of loans is reported this may indicate moral hazard behavior of group members.
predictor_var: 1 if the group member is a male
covariate_1: 1 if the group member knows (i.e., has information about) the activities of the other group members that are related to the use of the loan, i.e. has information about the income gener- ating (business) activities of other group members
covariate_2: 1 if the group member knows the monthly sales of the other group members;
covariate_3: average distance (in meters) between the group member and the other members of the group
covariate_4: 1 if the group member regularly visits the other group members.
covariate_5: 1 if the group member is born in the same area where the survey was held
covariate_6: 1 if the group member knows the other group members before forming the group
covariate_7: 1 if the group member has ever been member of another group
covariate_9: 1 if a representative of the credit program regularly visits the group
covariate_10: educational background of the group member, ranging from 1 (= illiterate) to 4 (= secondary schooling)
covariate_11: 1 if the group member is a Moslem
covariate_12: 1 if the group member is married
covariate_13: monthly income of the group member (in Nakfas)
covariate_14: 1 if the group members use informal rules on how to behave within the group
covariate_15: the value a group member attaches to having access to loans from the credit program in the future, rang- ing from 1 (= very high value) to 4 (= very low value)
covariate_16: 1 if all group members are of the same sex
covariate_17: 1 if a group is in the SZSCS program

outcome_var: 1 if the loan is fully repaid within specified period of time, otherwise zero
outcome_description: Measure of loan group repayment performance
predictor_var: 1 if group leader was female, otherwise zero
covariate_1: education level of the group leader, measured by the number of completed years while schooling
covariate_2: number of people that form a particular group
covariate_3: amount of time (in weeks) that the MFI devoted to training the group members on issues like loan management, group membership, sanctions and basic record keeping.
covariate_4: travelling costs (in Tanzanian shillings) incurred by the group for arranging, acquisition and repaying the loan
covariate_5: perception of members of the group of the impending threat of action against them in the event that they default in repaying the loan
covariate_6: whether members of the group have similar socio-economic background
covariate_8: number of years the group has participated in the credit programme of a given MFI
covariate_9: number of members in group in 2010
covariate_10: square of number of members in group in 2010

study: Berhane, Guush, Cornelis Gardebroek, and Henk AJ Moll, 2009
outcome_var: 1 for group members that had unresolved repayment problems after due date
covariate_1: 1 if borrower knew other members’ activities
covariate_2: 1 if borrower thinks he/she joined its “optimum” group
covariate_4: Distance (in KM) between major economic activities of group members
covariate_5: 1 if repay only because of moral obligation
covariate_6: 1 if borrower feels asset confiscation/prison is worst penalty upon default (compared to subsequent social problems)
covariate_7: 1 if participated in networks (e.g., Equb, Edir, Tsebel, etc.) with one or more group members
covariate_8: 1 if other (informal) sources of credit exist

outcome_description: three response of the group loan repayment performance with their ascending order based on the level of severity of their danger
covariate_3: 1 if loan officers follow up loans
covariate_8: 1 if group leader has experience in a similar business
covariate_11: 1 if repayment status of members disclosed
covariate_15: 1 if group has experience in recording financial statements
covariate_17: 1 if loan is easy to access
covariate_20: 1 if the loan repayment period is suitable
covariate_23: 1 if problem of power interruption exists
covariate_24: 1 if problem of water shortage exists
covariate_25: 1 if group enterprise has road access
covariate_26: 1 if group enterprise has input market access
covariate_27: 1 if group enterprise has output market access

outcome_var: 1 = individual contributes in round x (given that a subject had a successful investment and had the opportunity to contribute)
outcome_description: The individuals who suffer a random shock based on their draw from the bag of balls cannot contribute to group loan repayment, so the group debt is split among those individuals whose projects succeed and decide to contribute
covariate_3: 1 when member had received a shock the period before (implying other members had covered for focal player)
covariate_4: 1 if any other group members' projects failed in preceding round
covariate_6: 1 if taken out a loan in the past
covariate_7: The average fraction of a subject’s life lived in the region of the experiment
covariate_8: index of societal trust for each subject based on the number of yes (trusting) answers to the three standard GSS questions
covariate_9: Number of others in group with same religion
covariate_10: Interaction between 1 if "subjects bring to the experimental site a self-selected group of friends or acquaintances who formed their partners in the experiment" and "Number of acquaintances in group"

study: Jumpah, ET and Tetteh, EK and Adams, A, 2018
outcome_var: during the period of loan repayment if the respondent had difficulties to repay agreed amount at the scheduled time it is indicated zero (0) otherwise one (1) for the dependent variable
covariate_2: 1 if borrower attended Junior High School
covariate_3: distance from the farmers’ residence to the place of the credit granting agency in kilometres
covariate_6: Number of people farmer is taking care of
covariate_8: 1 if borrower perceives pressure from the credit granting agency
covariate_9: Interest rate as percentage of loan
covariate_10: Amount of loan in Ghana Cedis
covariate_11: Number of months over which loan must be repaid

outcome_var: 1 if the participant repaid their own loans and zero otherwise
outcome_description: we randomly assigned investment returns in order to exclude moral hazard and only focus on strategic defaults
covariate_5: 1 = most risk averse; 5 = least risk averse
covariate_6: response to three attitudinal questions from the General Society Survey (GSS) that relate to trust:  (1) Trust question: “Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you can't be to careful in dealing with people?” (2) Fairness question: “Do you think most people would try to take advantage of you if they got the chance or would they try to be fair?” (3) Helpfulness question: “Would you say that most of the time people try to be helpful or that they are mostly just looking out for themselves?”.
covariate_7: cooperation scale measured using participant responses to the following five statements: (1) It is better to cooperate than compete; (2) People should listen to their conscience when making decisions; (3) People should forgive others when they are angry; (4) It is amusing to play tricks on other people; and (5) People should right the wrongs that are done to them.
covariate_8: social connection index based on answers from the social networks survey
covariate_9: Investment returns are random, varying from 0 to 9 million points in increments of 1 million points with equal probability
covariate_11: Returns to other 3 members in the group
covariate_12: 1 if total investment returns of the group members were no less than 12 million points
covariate_14: Knowledge of other member's repayment status treatment
covariate_15: Interaction between Returns to other 3 members in the group and Monitoring treatment
covariate_16: Interaction between Total return threshold and Monitoring treatment
covariate_22: Interaction between Returns to other 3 members in the group and ILVT treatment

outcome_var: 1 for bad repayment performance and; 0 for good repayment performance
outcome_description: A payment falls into the bad payment category if it has been written off as a bad debt or needed to be rescheduled. If the group made more than one untimely payment or short paid the loan it will fall into the bad payment category.
predictor_var: 1 if one or more males in the group; 0 if the group is homogeneously female
covariate_5: total group loan size in Rands

outcome_var: 1 if the sample borrower i completed repayment before the due date
covariate_1: farthest geographic distance from the respondent’s house to a peer’s house, in km
covariate_2: percentage of group members who are relatives
covariate_3: percentage of group members who have cooperative relationships with the respondent
covariate_4: percentage of group members who are from the same village
covariate_6: number of household members in the labor force
covariate_9: 1 if the return on the microloan investment can cover the principal and interest required to pay
covariate_12: 1 if the family owns off-farm businesses
covariate_13: number of household members working outside the home
covariate_14: 1 if the family encounters any negative shock, such as sickness or crop losses, or owning other debts during the period of the loan
covariate_15: number of outside loan opportunities besides RCCs
covariate_16: 1 if the borrower needs a loan from the RCCs in the near future
covariate_17: 1 if the RCCs are the respondent’s first choice for a loan
covariate_18: 1 if any family member is a village official

outcome_description: borrower i’s repayment response given in contract j in round t
covariate_2: 1 if the subject opted for monitoring the repayment decision of his counterpart and zero otherwise in round
covariate_4: Participant education level: Undergraduate = 0, Graduate = 1, Postgraduate = 2

study: Sandar, TM and Charoenloet, V and Sriwichailamphan, T, 2010
outcome_var: 1, if the borrower had bad repayment history
outcome_description: Borrower has any history of late repayment or default
covariate_1: 1 if the group does not have social pressure against late repayment and default
covariate_2: 1 if the member’s home is far from the rest of the member
covariate_3: 1 if borrower age is between 20 to 40 year
covariate_5: 1 if the number of family members is 5 to 8
covariate_6: 1 if six to ten family members are age between 15 to 45year
covariate_7: 1 if the number of children in school are 5 to 8
covariate_8: 1 if the number of workers in family is 5 to 8
covariate_9: 1 if the number of dependency in family 5 to 8
covariate_10: 1 if the borrower’s occupation is seller or street vendor
covariate_11: 1 if the borrower’s occupation is animal breeding
covariate_12: 1 if the household head’s occupation is seller or street vendor
covariate_13: 1 if the household head is an employee of a company or NGOs
covariate_14: 1 if the family’s 1st priority business is animal breeding
covariate_15: 1 if the family’s 2nd priority business is a business or grocery shop
covariate_16: 1 if the family’s monthly income is 80,001 to 150,000(kyat)
covariate_17: 1 if the family’s monthly expenditure is 80,001 to 150,000 (kyat)
covariate_18: 1 if the borrower’s education is primary level
covariate_19: 1 if the borrower has more than three years experiences
covariate_20: 1 if the borrower borrowed between one to five times
covariate_21: 1 if the loan amount is under 100,000 kyat
covariate_22: 1 if the member lives in the same ward with the rest of the members
covariate_23: 1 if the member owns land and a house
covariate_24: 1 if the borrower or her family’s health problem affected them to be a bad borrower
covariate_25: the amount of the loan that is used for business investment (kyat)
covariate_26: 1 if the group has norms for evaluating each other
covariate_27: 1 if the borrower used 100 percentage of loan in the business
covariate_28: 1 if group members have strong guarantee for loan default
covariate_29: 1 if group members are willing to recognize for accepting new member or next higher loan
covariate_30: 1 if the borrower has an outside loan

study: Shahriar, S and Qian, L and Rahman, A and Hasan, M and Kea, S and Abdullahi, NM, 2020
outcome_var: 1 if there is default and 0 if there is repaid on time
outcome_description: There was delinquent respondent also but we merge delinquent and default as the same category after checking the payment due status because it shows if we get the chance to collect the data after the loan cycle the delinquent borrowers will be ultimately default borrowers
covariate_1: Age of the respondents in years
covariate_2: amount of loan disbursed to respondent in Taka
covariate_3: amount of payment due in Taka
covariate_4: 1 if respondent has education levels up to five years
covariate_5: 1 if respondent has education levels above five years
